awd_titl_txt: Analysis of McDonald Observatory Data on the Impact of      Comet Shoemaker-Levy 9 on Jupiter
awd_abstract_narration: 95-26313  Pryor  As part of NSF-funded follow-up studies of the Comet Shoemaker-Levy 9 impact on Jupiter in July 1994, Dr. Pryor proposes to analyze, model, and archive data obtained of the event with the telescopes of the University of Texas McDonald Observatory.    In particular, Dr. Pryor and his team members, both at the University of Colorado and the University of Texas, will analyze in detail the infrared and CCD imaging and spectroscopy data of the fireball that resulted from the impact of comet fragment R.  Furthermore, they will examine the data from the impacts of fragments F, U, and V for evidence of fireballs or plumes.    The goal is to determine the distribution of impact debris in the Jovian atmosphere; the origin of the material (cometary or Jovian); the impacts' effects on the vertical, zonal, and meridional winds in the Jovian stratosphere; the ultimate destruction processes of the material; and the amount of stratospheric water that accumulated over the impact sites.  **
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
